members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the abandoned checkout was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Abandoned checkout ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the abandoned checkout was updated.

members.name: activities
members.doc:
List of all automation activities performed by [Wix Automations](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-automations-getting-started) regarding the abandoned checkout.
Wix Automations updates the `activities` field for each actvity in the automation flow. Only relevant if you've set up [automations in the Dashboard](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-automations-creating-a-new-automation). Read more about `activities` in the [introduction](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-ecom-backend/abandonedcheckout/introduction).

members.name: buyerInfo
members.doc: Buyer information.

members.name: buyerLanguage
members.doc:
Language for communication with the buyer. Defaults to the site language.
For a site that supports multiple languages, this is the language the buyer selected.

members.name: cartId
members.doc: The associated cart ID.

members.name: checkoutId
members.doc: The associated checkout ID.

members.name: checkoutRecoveredDate
members.doc: Date and time the abandoned checkout was recovered.

members.name: checkoutUrl
members.doc: Checkout URL.

members.name: contactDetails
members.doc: Contact details.

members.name: conversionCurrency
members.doc: Currency the buyer used in checkout.

members.name: currency
members.doc: The store's currency.

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the abandoned checkout.

members.name: subtotalPrice
members.doc: Subtotal price of all line items, before discounts and before tax.

members.name: totalPrice
members.doc: Total price after discounts, gift cards, and tax.

description: Triggered when an abandoned checkout is recovered (the customer completes the checkout).

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the automation activity was created.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Automation activity type.

Supported properties: `UNKNOWN_TYPE`, `SCHEDULED`, `EMAIL_SENT`, `EMAIL_NOT_SENT`, `NOTIFICATION_SENT`, `TASK_CREATED`

members.name: activityType
members.doc: The type of the activity to add

members.doc: Id of the abandoned checkout to update

members.doc: The type of the activity to add

members.name: abandonedCheckout
members.doc: The updated abandoned checkout with the added activity

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: company
members.doc:
Company name.
Max length: `50`

members.name: firstName
members.doc:
First name.
Max length: `100`

members.name: lastName
members.doc:
Last name.
Max length: `100`

members.doc: Phone number.

members.name: vatId
members.doc: Tax information (for Brazil only). If ID is provided, `vatId.type` must also be set, `UNSPECIFIED` is not allowed.

description: Full contact details for an address

members.name: metadata

members.name: results
members.doc: __Deprecated.__ Use `abandonedCheckouts` instead.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Can't be used together with 'paging'. 'cursor_paging.cursor' can not be used together with 'filter' or 'sort'

members.name: filter
members.doc: A filter object. See documentation [here](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rnd/platformization-guidelines/api-query-language#platformization-guidelines_api-query-language_defining-in-protobuf)

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Can not be used together with 'cursor_paging'

members.name: search
members.doc: free text to match in searchable fields

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]

members.doc: Paging metadata. Contains cursor which can be used in next query.

members.name: expression
members.doc: search term or expression

members.name: fields
members.doc: fields to search in. if empty - server will search in own default fields

members.name: fuzzy
members.doc: flag if should use auto fuzzy search (allowing typos by a managed proximity algorithm)

members.name: mode
members.doc: boolean search mode

Buyer email address.
